Configuring LAN Connectivity Policy

Connectivity policies determine the connections and the network communication resources between the server and the LAN or SAN on the network. These policies use pools to assign MAC addresses, WWNs, and WWPNs to servers and to identify the vNICs and vHBAs that the servers use to communicate with the network.

To configure the LAN Connectivity Policy, perform the following:

 1. Select the Organization from the drop-down. By default, root is selected.

 2. Enter the policy Name.

 3. Select the vNIC from the drop-down. You can select multiple values from the list.

 4. Click Add to generate the policy.

Figure 5-10 LAN Connectivity Policy

 5. Click Save and Next to proceed further.
